message.content:
cs.PL, cs.LO, cs.AI, cs.DB, cs.SE

This paper is about introducing a new device for expressing mutually exclusive goals and queries in logic programming. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.PL (Programming Languages) which deals with the design, implementation, and analysis of programming languages and their associated tools and methodologies. The paper also discusses the operational and declarative semantics of the new device, which suggests that it could also be categorized under cs.LO (Logic in Computer Science). Additionally, the paper's focus on goal formulas and their semantics makes it relevant to cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) which deals with the study of intelligent agents and their behavior. The paper also discusses the limitations of traditional logic programming, which suggests that it could be categorized under cs.DB (Databases) which deals with the storage, retrieval, and management of data. Finally, the paper's focus on expressing mutually exclusive goals and queries could also make it relevant to cs.SE (Software Engineering) which deals with the design, development, and maintenance of software systems.
